description.narrative: The project supports green urban development in small and medium-sized cities in Belarus.
seat of a second-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Green Urban Development Plan for City of Novogrudok; Development of pilots on energy efficiency in Novogrudok (Investment in LEDs for lighting streets and public areas (indoor and outdoor), control gear and Energy Management Information Systems (EMIS); Investment in energy efficient equipment, plan

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Outcome 1: 1.1. Number of enhanced national policies and regulations in the area of public lighting and urban transportation that have been reviewed and approved by EOP 1.2. Number of officially approved green urban development plans in Project cities by EOP
Outcome 2: 2.1. Kilometers of private car travel displaced from modal switches to public transport by EOP 2.2. Average number of minutes of reduced bus journey time through sustainable urban transport measures in Novopolotsk and Polotsk 2.3. Number of persons using improved public transport services during Year 5
Outcome 3: 3.1. GJ saved on LEDs installedfor street lighting and public areas (indoor and outdoor), as well as new control gear and EMIS by EOP 3.2. Lifetime GJ saved from EE measures on municipal laundry by EOP
Outcome 4: 4.1. Number of completed or updated SEAPs and/or GUDPs by EOP 4.2. Number of officers in government who are dedicated to the promotion of urban low carbon growth to Belarusian cities by EOP 4.3. Number of hits on national website for promoting GUD by EOP

comment.narrative: Outcome 1: Development and adoption of green urban development plans. Outcome 2: Development of pilots on SUT in Novopolotsk and Polotsk Outcome 3: Development of pilots on energy efficiency in Novogrudok Outcome 4: Replication mechanisms for green urban development in Belarus

Outcome 1: 1.1 Consultations with the MoEnv, the Ministry Architecture and Construction, the Ministry of Transport, as well as with other stakeholders to discuss the developed recommendations for improvement of the national legislation in the area of urban development taking into account the criteria and indicators of green urban development are arranged. Proposals are submitted to the Ministry of Environment, the Ministry of Architecture and Construction, the Ministry of Transport and to other stakeholders.The proposals for update of the methodology for assessment of emissions from transport are finalized and submitted. The proposals have been prepared for amendment of legislative and regulatory documents in the field of sustainable transport development.
Outcome 1: 1.1 Three meetings have been organized to discuss recommendations for improvement of the national legislation in the area of urban development.

Outcome 1: 1.1. Development of the methodological materials and urban planning documents for the territorial bodies of the Ministry of Architecture and Construction taking into account the principles of green urban planning (based on the results of the discussion with the Ministry of Architecture, the MoEnv, departments of architecture and construction of cities (districts, regions), Institute of urban planning). 1.1.2. To develop three green urban development plans (GUDP) for Polotsk, Novopolotsk and Novogrudok and approve with local administrations. 1.1.3. Development of Manual on the preparation of green urban development plans; uploading on the webpage of the Project Outcome 2: 2.1. Study tour for representatives of stakeholders for familiarization with the best examples of European practice of implementing green urban development plans, including issues of mobility and energy efficiency 2.2. Development of the cycling network and public transport in the pilot Cities; Outcome 3: 3.1. Developed feasibility studies on the modernization of street lighting for 6 cities in Belarus 3.2. Monitoring and collecting the data on the monthly electricity consumption of the street lighting system equipment performance. Report on the results of monitoring to the Energy Efficiency Department and the Ministry of Housing and Utilities. 3.3. Installation of a smart metering system for energy resources at residential facilities Outcome 4: 4.1. Support of the project website 4.2. Promotion low carbon growth in Belarusian cities; Dissemination of information materials and publications 4.3. Development of 3 investment concepts for financing green infrastructure projects in pilot cities (Polotsk, Novopolotsk, and Novogrudok) 4.4. Preparation of Green urban development plans for Korma, Zelva, Gorodok and Krychev

Outcome 1: 1.1. The first version of methodological materials for the territorial bodies of the Ministry of Architecture and Construction was prepared to take into account the principles of green urban planning in the development of technical specifications for urban planning documents; representatives of the departments of architecture and construction (118 districts and regions) were familiarized with the methodological materials of the project and its results. 1.2. GUDPs were developed and discussed with representatives of the cities working groups the available results, possible further steps to monitor the implementation of plans, collect information for indicators of green urban planning and possible adjustments to the strategy. 1.3. Guideline for the development of green urban planning plans has been finalized; an online version of the Guide has been prepared and video course Development of Green Urban Development Plans has been recorded and uploaded to the Project website. Outcome 2: 2.1. A study visit to Germany has been organized for representatives of Polotsk, Novopolotsk and Novogrudok Sustainable Urban Development: Best Cases from German Experience (March 1-5, 2020, Berlin-Hamburg). The visit was organized together with the German energy agency (Dena) 2.2. The following works on improving cycling network have been completed: - 8 bicycle garages in Novopolotsk; - 24 bicycle parking lots near educational, sports, and medical institutions in Polotsk; - the works on the restoration of the asphalt-concrete pavement of the cycle path of the park zone in the area of the Western Dvina floodplain in Novopolotsk (from the bridge to Druzhba street); - the works on the supply and installation of road signs along cycle lanes along the streets of Novopolotsk for the implementation of the scheme for organizing public transport traffic movements and the allocation of pedestrian zones in Novopolotsk;- the works on the restoration of the asphalt-concrete pavement of the footpath of the park area in the floodplain of the Western Dvina River in Polotsk;- the works on the arrangement of the bike path along Zygina street in Polotsk (the length of the bike path is 251 m.); - the works on the supply and installation of concrete separators along cycle paths in the central part of Polotsk. The following construction works on improving public transport have been completed: (a) production and installation of 10 public transport shelters in Polotsk and Novopolotsk have been completed; (b) landscaping works around 10 public transport stops in Polotsk and Novopolotsk; (c) arrangement of an additional pedestrian crossing within the framework of an innovative traffic management scheme in Polotsk; (d) delivery and installation of 6 controllers for traffic lights for Novopolotsk (str. Blohina); (e) road works on the arrangement of horizontal road markings with white plastic in the city of Polotsk; (f) road works for the supply and installation of road signs for the implementation of an innovative traffic management scheme in Polotsk; (g) landscaping works for the central streets in the city of Polotsk within the framework of an innovative traffic management scheme; (h) supply and installation of road artificial irregularities within the framework of an innovative traffic management scheme in Polotsk; (i) construction of three traffic ligths along Blohina str. in Novopolotsk; Outcome 3: 3.1. Feasibility studies on the modernization of street lighting for Brest, Novopolotsk, Pruzhany, Korma, Brest, and Zelva have been developed. 3.2. Annual monitoring of the equipment performance is completed. Data on the monthly electricity consumption of the street lighting system after modernization have been collected. A report was prepared based on the results of monitoring. The monitoring results in the form of a report have been submitted to the Energy Efficiency Department and the Ministry of Housing and Utilities. The energy savings - 30% of energy consumption. 3.3. Construction and installation works at the residential buildings in Novogrudok have been completed for electricity, water, heat. Construction and installation works for gas system are partly completed (has scheduled for early January 2021); Outcome 4: 4.1. The Project website is successfully operated; 4.2. Investment concepts for financing green infrastructure projects in the pilot cities of the Project (Polotsk, Novopolotsk and Novogrudok) have been developed. 4.3. Green urban development plans for Korma, Zelva, Gorodok and Krichev have been approved by local administrations
